description: Application under s73 (minor material amendment) to vary condition 34 (Energy Centre Details) and to remove condition 35 (CHP Feasibility study) of planning permission P062806 dated 30 April 2007 for the: ‘Outline planning application showing layout, scale and access for the phased demolition and phased redevelopment of the Packington Estate allowing for the erection of part 1 to 8 storey buildings (some with basement level) to provide for: 538 (264x1, 134x2, 95x3, 28x4, 14x5 and 3x6 bedroom) affordable housing flats/maisonettes/houses (1695 habitable rooms), 301 (181x1 and 120x2 bedroom) market-housing flats for private sale (722 habitable rooms), 800sqm of retail floorspace (A1 use), 290sqm community centre (D1 use) and an outdoor recreation facility of no less than 446sqm.  Erection of a 3-storey 300sqm workshop (B1 use) and single storey 200sqm youth centre (D1 use).  Provision of an adventure playground of no less than 997sqm in area, open space (hard and soft landscaped and play areas) of no less than 8778sqm, semi-private open space of no less than 540sqm and private gardens of no less than 12,448sqm; Creation of new roads and a cycle path, no more than 270 car parking spaces and no less than 420 bicycle spaces.  Erection of a Combined Heat and Power / biomass energy facility and green/brown roofs covering an area no less than 1372sqm. (DEPARTURE FROM PLAN owing to the loss of 2442sqm of open space).’ The minor material amendments sought are to agree the replacement of the consented biomass boiler with an increased capacity CHP unit to achieve an overall CO2 emissions reduction.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: Approval of the details of the Appearance of the buildings and Landscaping of the site for each phase of development (hereinafter called 'the reserved matters') shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced. 

REASON: In order that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied with the details of the proposal as provided for in Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) Order 1995.
